title: Djokovic & Sinner cross paths; Discover more stars training at Wimbledon
description: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner shared a brief embrace Tuesday at Wimbledon while crossing paths on the Aorangi Park practice courts. Many stars are arriving early at the All England Club to prepare for the season‚Äôs third major, which begins Monday, 30 June. Sinner practised with Grigor Dimitrov on Tuesday while Djokovic hit with Stefanos Tsitsipas, who is now coached by the Serbian‚Äôs former coach Goran Ivanisevic. Djokovic recently clashed against Sinner in a semi-final showing at Roland Garros, where the Italian advanced in straight sets. Sinner, No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, now leads Djokovic 5-4 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. Could their 10th tour-level meeting come at Wimbledon? Scroll down to view photos from Tuesday‚Äôs practice sessions. All photo credits belong to¬†Dan Istitene/Getty Images. Jannik Sinner will be the top seed at Wimbledon. Lorenzo Musetti, a semi-finalist last year at SW19, practises on Tuesday. Grigor Dimitrov will be making his 15th appearance at Wimbledon, where he reached the semi-finals in 2014. Novak Djokovic cracks a laugh during his practice session. Goran Ivanisevic, 2001 Wimbledon champion, is now coaching Stefanos Tsitsipas, a partnership that began this month. Wimbledon main-draw actions begins Monday, 30 June. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner shared a brief embrace Tuesday at Wimbledon while crossing paths on the Aorangi Park practice courts. View photos from the early practice sessions.

html:
Wimbledon

Could the Serbian and World No. 1 Sinner clash at grass-court major?

June 24, 2025

Dan Istitene/Getty Images

Novak Djokovic greets Jannik Sinner's coach Darren Cahill while the Italian looks on. By ATP Staff

Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner shared a brief embrace Tuesday at Wimbledon while crossing paths on the Aorangi Park practice courts.

Many stars are arriving early at the All England Club to prepare for the season‚Äôs third major, which begins Monday, 30 June. Sinner practised with Grigor Dimitrov on Tuesday while Djokovic hit with Stefanos Tsitsipas, who is now coached by the Serbian‚Äôs former coach Goran Ivanisevic.

Djokovic recently clashed against Sinner in a semi-final showing at Roland Garros, where the Italian advanced in straight sets. Sinner, No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, now leads Djokovic 5-4 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. Could their 10th tour-level meeting come at Wimbledon?

Scroll down to view photos from Tuesday‚Äôs practice sessions. All photo credits belong to¬†Dan Istitene/Getty Images.


Jannik Sinner will be the top seed at Wimbledon.


Lorenzo Musetti, a semi-finalist last year at SW19, practises on Tuesday.


Grigor Dimitrov will be making his 15th appearance at Wimbledon, where he reached the semi-finals in 2014.


Novak Djokovic cracks a laugh during his practice session.


Goran Ivanisevic, 2001 Wimbledon champion, is now coaching Stefanos Tsitsipas, a partnership that began this month.


Wimbledon main-draw actions begins Monday, 30 June.
